byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Chicago, and Timothy Williams from New York. Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York, and Mitch Smith from Chicago.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS

abstract: Police board selects Cedric L Alexander, Anne Kirkpatrick and Eugene Williams as finalists for position of Chicago police chief, which may be most challenging job in United States law enforcement; final decision will be made by Mayor Rahm Emanuel, who faces mounting pressure to mend police force's relationship with city residents.

headline.main: Facing Criticism, Rahm Emanuel Weighs 3 Choices to Lead Chicago Police

snippet: The candidates include a retired police chief from Spokane, a public safety director from Georgia and a longtime Chicago officer.
lead_paragraph: The candidates include a retired police chief from Spokane, a public safety director from Georgia and a longtime Chicago officer.
